test_description: This test covers file system concepts, implementation, disk management, and I/O systems in operating systems.

questions.question: What is a file system in operating systems?
questions.options_a: The method and data structure for storing and organizing files
questions.options_c: The network protocol for file transfer
questions.options_d: The user interface for file management

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common file access method?
questions.options_a: Random Access

questions.question: What is the purpose of a directory structure in a file system?
questions.options_a: To organize files in a hierarchical manner

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common file allocation method?
questions.options_a: Stack Allocation

questions.question: What is the main advantage of contiguous file allocation?
questions.options_a: Fast sequential access

questions.question: What is the main disadvantage of linked file allocation?
questions.options_a: Inefficient for random access

questions.question: What is the purpose of free space management in file systems?
questions.options_a: To track which disk blocks are available for allocation

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common free space management technique?
questions.options_a: Stack Management

questions.question: What is the basic structure of a disk?
questions.options_a: Platters divided into tracks and sectors

questions.question: What is disk scheduling?
questions.options_a: Determining the order of disk I/O requests to minimize head movement

questions.question: Which disk scheduling algorithm services requests in the direction the head is moving until no more requests in that direction?
questions.options_a: SCAN (Elevator Algorithm)

questions.question: What is RAID in storage systems?
questions.options_a: Redundant Array of Independent Disks

questions.question: What is the main purpose of I/O systems in an operating system?
questions.options_a: To manage communication between the computer and its peripherals

questions.question: What is DMA (Direct Memory Access)?
questions.options_a: A method for devices to access memory without CPU intervention

questions.question: What is the purpose of buffering in I/O systems?
questions.options_a: To smooth out differences in data transfer rates

questions.question: What is caching in I/O systems?
questions.options_a: Keeping frequently accessed data in faster storage

questions.question: What is the main advantage of journaling file systems?
questions.options_a: Faster recovery after crashes

questions.question: What is the purpose of the open() system call in file operations?
questions.options_a: To establish a connection between a process and a file

questions.question: What is wear leveling in flash memory systems?
questions.options_a: Distributing writes evenly across memory cells

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the I/O scheduler in an operating system?
questions.options_a: To optimize the order of I/O operations
